title: Will Charleston’s Climate Lawsuit Survive the Week?
snippets: The city is suing oil companies over global warming. Trump says lawsuits like these threaten national security. The judge wants to hear what both sides think.

constructiveness_reason: This story informs readers about a significant ongoing lawsuit, providing context about the city's efforts to hold oil companies accountable for global warming. This approach comes as the Diamondbacks prepare for their upcoming game against the Washington Nationals, aiming to break their losing streak and turn the season around.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful insight into the management strategies of the Arizona Diamondbacks during a challenging time, potentially aiding readers' understanding of how sports teams adapt to adversity. title: Trump says U.S. will double steel tariffs to 50%
snippets: President Trump will hold a rally Friday at a U.S. Steel plant near Pittsburgh, one week after signaling he had cleared a merger with Japan's Nippon Steel.
US president escalates global trade war days after a court ruled some of his levies illegal

On Friday, President Donald Trump said he plans to double steel tariffs to 50%.

Speaking at U.S. Steel’s (X) Irvin Works in West Mifflin, Pa., the president said the move would help protect American steelworkers and “further secure the steel industry.”

Since March 12, 25% tariffs on steel imports have been in place. The U.S. imports roughly 25 million tons of steel each year, which accounts for 23% of all the steel used domestically. Canada, Mexico, Brazil and South Korea sending the most steel to the U.S.

The announcement came after Trump gave the green light last week to a "partnership" between U.S. Steel and Nippon Steel. Shares of U.S. Steel have surged 40% since Trump last month ordered a review of Nippon Steel's proposed takeover bid.

It also came in the wake of a flurry of legal actions in cases that challenged some of Trump's tariffs. A court initially blocked the order, but the administration was given a reprieve while further appeals work their way through the court. The block would not have applied to the steel tariffs.

This isn't the first time Trump has imposed steel tariffs. In his first term, he imposed a 25% tariff on steel. Trump has said tariffs would give U.S. steel producers a leg up and prevent job losses in the industry. Economists and researchers found that those tariffs had a mixed effect on jobs, as steel companies hired more workers but companies that use steel hired fewer people.
titles: Trump says U.S. will double steel tariffs to 50%
Trump says he will double tariffs on US steel imports to 50%
Trump Says He Will Double Steel Tariffs
summary: President Trump announced plans to double steel tariffs to 50% during a rally at U.S. Steel's Irvin Works in West Mifflin, Pennsylvania. This move, aimed at protecting American steelworkers and securing the steel industry, follows a 25% tariff on steel imports instituted since March 12. The announcement comes after Trump approved a partnership between U.S. Steel and Nippon Steel, leading to a 40% surge in U.S. Steel shares. The decision occurs amidst legal challenges to some of Trump's tariffs, though these challenges did not affect the steel tariffs specifically. Trump's previous imposition o
constructiveness_reason: The story provides a useful context about the decision to double steel tariffs, its potential impact on the American steel industry, and the legal challenges to some of Trump's tariffs. However, it does not offer solutions or discuss the broader impacts on the U.S. economy or international trade relations.

title: International Research Team Builds World’s Most Efficient Organic Solar Cell
snippets: Scientists created a safer, high-efficiency all-organic solar cell using a new electrode and lamination technique, achieving 8.7% power conversion, more than double past models. As global initiatives to mitigate climate change accelerate, the demand for solar energy continues to rise. However, conventional silicon-based solar panels, which currently dominate the market, contain a variety of hazardous [...]
titles: International Research Team Builds World’s Most Efficient Organic Solar Cell
summary: An international research team has developed the world's most efficient all-organic solar cell, reaching a power conversion efficiency of 8.7%, more than doubling the efficiency of previous models. This advancement was made possible through the use of a new electrode and lamination technique. This development is significant as it offers a safer alternative to conventional silicon-based solar panels, which contain hazardous materials. The breakthrough could accelerate the adoption of solar energy in global efforts to combat climate change.
constructiveness_reason: This story is highly constructive because it reports on a significant innovation in the field of renewable energy. It provides useful information about the new technology and its implications for the environment and energy sector. The story also highlights the progress made in improving the efficiency of organic solar cells, contributing to the reader's understanding of ongoing efforts to combat climate change.

title: Dinosaur eggshell study confirms biogenic origin of secondary eggshell units
snippets: The calcitic layers of the eggshells of archosaurs (including crocodilians and birds) and turtles are composed of distinctive crystalline structures known as eggshell units. Those growing from the shell membrane are called primary eggshell units (PEUs), while those forming within the calcitic layer are called secondary eggshell units (SEUs). Although rare in modern bird eggs, SEUs are common in dinosaur eggs. Due to the lack of in-depth research on this structure, however, scientists are uncertain whether they are biogenic or abiogenic in origin.
titles: Dinosaur eggshell study confirms biogenic origin of secondary eggshell units
summary: Researchers have identified two types of crystalline structures in the eggshells of archosaurs (which include crocodilians and birds) and turtles, known as primary eggshell units (PEUs) and secondary eggshell units (SEUs). PEUs originate from the shell membrane, while SEUs form within the calcitic layer. SEUs, though rare in modern bird eggs, were common in dinosaur eggs. The origin of SEUs, whether biological or non-biological, remains uncertain due to limited research on these structures.
constructiveness_reason: The story provides useful information about the research on dinosaur eggshells, which contributes to a deeper understanding of the subject. However, it does not highlight any significant progress or solutions, nor does it provide actionable insights for the reader.
